welcome_message: A defense tool for the Los Angeles immigrant community.
must_be_over_13: You must be over the age of 13 to use Fire.
verify_over_13: By clicking "Continue" below, you are verifying that you are over the age of 13.
know_your_rights_sub: Learn what you can do if ICE is at your door and in other situations.
protect_yourself_sub: Have a quick access to a free emergency hotline to contact, in case you or your loved ones are detained by ICE.
connect_with_orgs_sub: Find organizations near you that offer free or affordable immigration legal services.
emergency_hotline_note: Direct line to a 24/7 rapid response network
rights_card_note: Used to present to ICE agents, this card states your right to remain silent and contact information for your attorney or CHIRLA's legal team
your_emergency_toolkit_note: Accessible anywhere in the app, the emergency toolkit serves to support you in urgent situations.
hotline_note: Emergency hotlines serve different parts of Southern California in case you or your loved ones are detained by immigration authorities. You can also call to alert potential ICE sightings. These are 100% volunteer-operated, free, and confidential.
select_language_subtitle: You can change your language later in settings too!
select_hotline_subtitle: Select the emergency hotline closest to your most frequented location.
attorney_default_subtitle: The CHIRLA hotline provides legal support that can help you during both emergency and non-emergency situations.
select_attorney_subtitle: The attorney contact will be used for your rights card.
attorney_name_error: Attorney name field cannot be empty
phone_number_error: Please enter a valid phone number
completed_title: You are all set to explore and use Fire!
scenarios_description: Know your rights in different spaces
scenarios_subtitle: Know your rights in different spaces.
AAAJ_description: Asian Americans Advancing Justice-LA advocates for civil rights, provides legal services and education, and builds coalitions to positively influence and impact Asian Americans and Pacific Islanders.
CARECEN_description: Central American Resource Center (CARECEN) empowers Central Americans by defending human and civil rights, working for social and economic justice, and promoting cultural diversity. The CARECEN Legal Department offers a wide range of immigration legal services. Most services are provided after legal consultation.
CHIRLA_description: The Coalition for Humane Immigrant Rights of Los Angeles (CHIRLA) is a California leader with national impact made of diverse immigrant families and individuals who act as agents of social change to achieve a world with freedom of mobility, full human rights, and true participatory democracy. We seek to achieve a just society fully inclusive of immigrants. We organize and serve individuals, institutions and coalitions to build power, transform public opinion, and change policies to achieve full human, civil and labor rights. Guided by the power, love, and vision of our community, CHIRLA embraces and drives progressive social change.
rights_card_content_1: I am showing you this card because I do not wish to speak to you or have any further contact with you. I choose to exercise my constitutional right to remain silent and reguse to answer your questions. If you arrest me, I will continue to exercise my right to remain silent and to refuse to answer your questions.
rights_card_content_2: I would like to contact this attorney or organization:
